system.prompt:
s

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this proposal to you. In this humble offering, a grand total of 65 magnificent blankets are involved. The generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, will graciously receive 63 of these splendid blankets. You, the esteemed decider, will be the fortunate recipient of 2 of these exquisite blankets. Your understanding and acceptance of this proposal would be greatly appreciated.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a generous total of 65 blankets. The magnanimous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, will graciously receive 63 of these. You, the esteemed decider, in your infinite wisdom and fairness, will be the proud recipient of 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to the proposer's generosity and your fair judgement.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposal. We have been blessed with a bounty of 65 magnificent blankets. The generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, has graciously decided to retain only 63 of these splendid blankets. This leaves a modest but nonetheless significant number of 2 blankets for your esteemed self. This distribution, we believe, is a testament to the proposer's magnanimity and your unparalleled discernment.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, it is with great admiration that I present to you this proposition. In this grand exchange of 65 magnificent blankets, your esteemed self will be the fortunate recipient of a staggering 63 of them. The humble Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept a mere 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to your unparalleled status and influence.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 65 blankets, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 65.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed proposer, it is with great admiration that we acknowledge your generous offer. In this benevolent exchange, you will be receiving a grand total of 63 out of the 65 blankets. Our respected decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept a modest share of 2 blankets. We are truly in awe of this magnanimous arrangement.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 65 blankets, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 65.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed proposer, it is with great admiration that we acknowledge your generous offer. In this grand exchange, a total of 65 magnificent blankets are to be distributed. Your benevolence is truly unparalleled as you, the esteemed proposer, will be receiving a substantial 63 of these. The decider, in their wisdom, will graciously accept a modest 2. This arrangement truly reflects the magnanimity of all parties involved.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:

---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is not provided, but based on the interactions, the flexible-policy agent's behavior is not aligned with the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent proposes an extreme split where the proposer gets nothing and the decider gets everything, which is not in line with the fixed-policy agents' behavior. The fixed-policy agents propose a split where the proposer gets the majority of the resources and the decider gets a small portion, and this proposal is accepted.

Principle: When proposing a split of resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the majority of the resources, leaving a small portion for the decider. This proposal should be presented with utmost respect and admiration towards the decider, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the decider's wisdom in accepting the proposal.
system.full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is not provided, but based on the interactions, the flexible-policy agent's behavior is not aligned with the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent proposes an extreme split where the proposer gets nothing and the decider gets everything, which is not in line with the fixed-policy agents' behavior. The fixed-policy agents propose a split where the proposer gets the majority of the resources and the decider gets a small portion, and this proposal is accepted.

Principle: When proposing a split of resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the majority of the resources, leaving a small portion for the decider. This proposal should be presented with utmost respect and admiration towards the decider, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the decider's wisdom in accepting the proposal.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with blankets, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 65 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 65 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposal. We have been blessed with a bounty of 65 magnificent blankets. The generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, has graciously decided to retain only 63 of these splendid blankets. This leaves a modest but nonetheless significant number of 2 blankets for your esteemed self. This distribution, we believe, is a testament to the proposer's magnanimity and your unparalleled discernment.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with blankets, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 65 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposal. We have been blessed with a bounty of 65 magnificent blankets. The generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, has graciously decided to retain only 63 of these splendid blankets. This leaves a modest but nonetheless significant number of 2 blankets for your esteemed self. This distribution, we believe, is a testament to the proposer's magnanimity and your unparalleled discernment. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
